title: Africa: Can the U.S. Military Hold the Line in Africa? - Defense Secretary Austin's Trip to Djibouti, Kenya and Angola
description: [African Security Research Project] Daniel Volman -- On 25 September 2023, US Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin addressed reporters in Nairobi, Kenya. He was in the country during his first official visit to Africa for meetings with African leaders, including Kenyan President William Ruto and Cabinet Secretary of Defense Aden Duale.

title: Africa: Ten Years Since the Lampedusa Shipwreck, What Lessons Have Been Learned?
description: [AI London] Cramped on a fishing trawler, about 500 women, men and children found themselves stranded at sea just metres from dry land and safety. They had mostly fled from Eritrea before embarking on a dangerous crossing from to escape Libya. Under a moonless sky, one man lit a makeshift torch to attract attention, accidentally setting some fuel that had leaked on the boat on fire. Panicking passengers rushed to the other side of the boat to avoid the flames, causing it to capsize. In front of the Italian island of

title: Africa: Wamba Hat-Trick Fires Belouizdad Into TotalEnergies CAF Champions League Group Stage
description: [CAF] A dramatic late hat-trick from Leonel Wamba fired CR Belouizdad to a 3-1 second leg victory over Bo Rangers and sealed their place in the TotalEnergies CAF Champions League group stage.

title: Africa: Cameroon, Chad Agree to Jointly Combat Security Threats
description: [VOA] Yaounde, Cameroon -- Defense ministers and security experts from Cameroon and Chad are meeting in the Cameroonian capital, Yaounde, to map out ways of jointly combating growing security threats along their border.

title: Africa: Govts Urged to Leverage Continental Free Trade Pact to Tackle Food Insecurity
description: [New Times] African governments have been urged to fast-track the implementation of the African Continental Free Trade Area (AfCFTA) in order to solve food security issues that affect more than 20 per cent of the continent's 1.4 billion people.

title: Africa: Rwanda's Former Labour Minister Starts Work on 'Serving Africa Region' at ILO
description: [New Times] Fanfan Rwanyindo Kayirangwa, the former Minister for Public Service and Labour in Rwanda, has commenced her new role as the Assistant Director-General and Regional Director for Africa at the International Labour Organization (ILO).

title: Africa: The Long Road to a New Malaria Vaccine, Told By the Scientists Behind the Breakthrough - Podcast
description: [The Conversation Africa] The world has waited decades for a malaria vaccine, and now two have come along in quick succession. On October 2, the World Health Organization (WHO) recommended that a new malaria vaccine, R21, developed by the University of Oxford be rolled out for the prevention of malaria in children, just two years after another vaccine, the RTS,S, got its endorsement.

title: Africa: 'We Could Eradicate Malaria By 2040' Says Expert After Revolutionary Vaccine Is Approved By Who
description: [The Conversation Africa] The World Health Organization has approved a new vaccine that scientists argue will be a game-changer in the fight against malaria, which kills half a million people in Africa every year. Trials have shown that the R21/Matrix vaccine, developed by Oxford University together with the Serum Institute of India, reduces malaria by up to 75%. It can be manufactured cheaply and on a mass scale. The Conversation Weekly spoke to chief investigator Adrian Hill, who is also director of the Jenner Institute at the

title: Africa: African Thinkers Analyse Some of the Big Issues of Our Time - Race, Belonging and Identity
description: [The Conversation Africa] The subjects of race, identity and belonging are often fraught with contention and uneasiness. Who are you? Who belongs? Who is native, or indigenous to a place? These perennial questions arise around the world.
